title: Segregation Of Circuits
fullText:
In addition to the requirements detailed in AS/NZS 3000, segregation shall be provided between d.c. and a.c. circuits to the same requirements as for segregation of different voltage levels in AS/NZS 3000.
The different types of circuits shall be clearly identified (e.g. by labels or different coloured cables).
NOTE: These labels should be typically every 2 to 3 m, depending on the route of the cable and its accessibility.
